item.title: Destiny 2: Ammo Generation, Explained
item.description:
The launch of The Edge of Fate brought about a lot of changes to the core mechanics of Destiny 2 , and one such affected mechanic is ammo generation. Instead of being completely random, ammo brick drops are now a bit more deterministic, and players should now have more ways to top their munitions off while fending off hordes of enemies.

Every gun post- Edge of Fate comes with an Ammo Generation stat, and this can drastically affect how players use their weapons in Destiny 2 . This guide covers how this Ammo Generation stat works, as well as some tips on how to make the most out of it.

What Does Ammo Generation Do in Destiny 2?

Ammo Generation refers to how quickly a weapon can fill up the Special and Heavy Ammo bars found at the bottom-left side of the screen. Once these bars are filled, an ammo brick of the corresponding type will pop out of the next enemy you defeat.

The higher the Ammo Generation stat, the quicker these bars will fill. There are a few things to keep in mind, though:

  • All weapons (except Swords) can contribute to the build-up of the ammo meters.
  • Primary weapons generate the most ammo out of all weapon types.
  • Special and Heavy weapons generate more ammo for the ammo type that they do not use.
  • Ammo meter progress only increases when you defeat enemies, not when you damage them.

How to Increase Ammo Generation in Destiny 2

Apart from just using weapons with better Ammo Generation, you can make your ammo meters progress faster by using mods or perks . If you're using a Legendary weapon, you can use the Bandolier and Abundant Ammo mods to increase their Ammo Generation stat. Otherwise, perks like Impromptu Ammunition can boost Ammo Generation for all of your weapons.

As far as Destiny 2 armor mods go, you can install Ammo Generation Chest mods . These will boost the Ammo Generation for weapons of a specific element. Meanwhile, Ammo Finder Helmet mods make anything that increases your ammo meter more effective.

Alternatively, you can install Scavenger mods in your leg armor — Scavenger mods won't increase Ammo Generation, but they'll make it so that you get more bullets per ammo brick you pick up.

Additionally, the Weapon stat in your armor will give you a chance to get more bullets per ammo brick, but only if the stat exceeds 100. The higher your total Weapons stat, the bigger the chance you have at getting more ammo (and you'll deal more damage to bosses and Guardians too).

Destiny 2
52
7.7 /10
Released
August 28, 2017

item.title: Wuchang: Fallen Feathers PC Requirements Revealed
item.description:
Leenzee Games has officially revealed the minimum and recommended PC specifications for Wuchang: Fallen Feathers , giving PC players a breakdown of what kind of hardware they’ll need to get ready for the upcoming Soulslike. First announced back in 2021, Wuchang: Fallen Feathers is set in 17th-century China during the last stretch of the Ming dynasty, mixing historical settings with heavy dark fantasy elements.

Wuchang: Fallen Feathers follows Bai Wuchang, a pirate who’s suffering from memory loss and a strange illness called Feathering Disease. As she travels through the war-ravaged region of Shu, she starts uncovering details about her past while also coming face to face with monstrous enemies spreading across the land. In April, Leenzee confirmed that Wuchang: Fallen Feathers would release on July 24. It’ll be available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC through both Steam and the Epic Games Store.

With launch day drawing closer, the developers have gradually been releasing more Wuchang: Fallen Feathers details, and now the official PC requirements have been posted. The minimum specs suggest that the game is accessible to many players with mid-range systems, such as those running an Intel Core i5-8400 or AMD Ryzen 5 1600, with 16GB of RAM and a GTX 1060 or RX 580. The game can run off an HDD, but an SSD is recommended to keep things smoother. According to the devs, DLSS or FSR was used during testing, which means the game supports upscaling technology for better frame rates on modest hardware.

Wuchang: Fallen Feathers PC Requirements

Minimum

  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 64bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i5-8400/AMD Ryzen 5 1600
  • Memory: 16GB RAM (dual channel recommended)
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 6GB/AMD Radeon RX 580 8GB
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 60 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: HDD Supported, SSD Recommended. The above specifications were tested with DLSS/FSR enabled.

Recommended

  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10/11 64bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i7-9700/AMD Ryzen 5 5500
  • Memory: 16GB RAM (dual channel recommended)
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2070/AMD Radeon RX 5700 XT/Intel Arc A750
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 60 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: SSD Required. The above specifications were tested with DLSS/FSR enabled.

The recommended requirements for Soulslike Wuchang: Fallen Feathers are aimed at players who want smoother performance and better visuals. An Intel Core i7-9700 or AMD Ryzen 5 5500, along with a GPU like the RTX 2070, Radeon RX 5700 XT, or Intel Arc A750, should be enough to run the game well. RAM stays at 16GB across both tiers, but here an SSD isn’t just suggested - it’s required, likely to ensure stable performance and faster loading. The game, which runs on 64-bit versions of Windows 10 or 11 and needs DirectX 12, also requires 60 GB of free space.

Altogether, the PC specs suggest Leenzee is aiming to keep the game accessible to a decent range of machines while still offering stronger performance for those with more powerful setups. As fans await the game's official release, they’ve been given a deeper look into its development. In a recent interview, director Xia Siyuan went into more detail about Wuchang: Fallen Feathers ' combat systems and explained how Chinese mythology helped shape both the visual identity and core themes of Wuchang: Fallen Feathers .

item.title: 20 Awesome Side Quests Hidden In Cyberpunk 2077
item.description:
Cyberpunk 2077 remains extremely expansive, and within Night City and Dogtown, V can easily get caught up in the whirlwind of the wild characters within, and involve themselves in the lives of these wacky characters and their stories. Cyberpunk 2077 doesn’t just have quests and side jobs that are shown to them, there are some secret quests in Cyberpunk 2077 just waiting to be discovered.

With so much to do in Night City, it’s no surprise that there are some secret quests that even the most veteran of players might not know about. To continue finding things to do in Night City, look to these awesome hidden side quests in Cyberpunk 2077 to see if you’ve completed them all.

Updated on July 17, 2025, by Jake Fillery: Cyberpunk 2077 is filled with amazing side quests, but some are right under V and Johnny's noses. Throughout Cyberpunk 2077's base game, Update 2.3, and Phantom Liberty, players will certainly miss something if they aren't familiar with every nook and cranny of Night City. Listed below, players will find some great side quests that are not marked on the map, and bring about plenty of surprises that continue forward with a quest chain of their own.

20 They Won't Go When I Go

Talk to a Con As They Prepare For Crucifixion on a Braindance

  • Location: Dewdrop Inn, Arroyo, Santo Domingo
  • How to Acquire: Complete Life During Wartime and accept Sinnerman, a gig from Wakako Okada
  • Rewards: 3,100 to 9,300 Eurodollars

This is certainly a side job that players will not want to miss, but it will require them to be hesitant on the trigger. By starting the Sinnerman gig from Wakako Okada, V will be tasked with killing Joshua Stephenson, a convict who is currently being transferred by a private detail, and a murderer who Wakako's client wants to make pay. However, things go south fast when the client is killed, and the man V was sent to kill wishes to speak with V.

If V restrains from killing Stephenson, and even agrees to get in the vehicle that houses him, players will learn of his self-righteous task to be absolved of his sins through crucifixion. The quest chain that follows from Sinnerman, to There Is A Light That Never Goes Out, to They Won't Go When I Go is philosophically profound, and while there is no action to be had here, it's one of the best side jobs that players can miss if they're too trigger-happy.

19 I’m in Love with My Car

Acquire a Free Car from an Abandoned Warehouse

  • Location: Northside Warehouse, north-east of Watson
  • How to Acquire: Complete Act One
  • Rewards: Quadra Type-66 "Hoon"

Sure, V might not be the right age to be a pro-racer, nor do they have the time and the ability, but that doesn't mean they cannot indulge in some fun. This secret quest is short and sweet, but it will reward players with a pretty cool-looking vehicle, the Quadra Type-66 "Hoon", a secret car that will be waiting for them in a warehouse.

The vehicle itself has great top speed and acceleration, and its design even comes fitted with two machine guns. It's always nice to find a secret in Night City, especially one that awards players with a vehicle for their troubles.

18 Love Rollercoaster

Fix a Broken Rollercoaster to Make Memories with Johnny

  • Location: Eden Beach, Coastview, Pacifica
  • How to Acquire: Complete Act One
  • Rewards: None

While there is no reward for this quest in a physical sense, players will be rewarded in fun and good times with their best pal Johnny Silverhand. The quest has players fix up an old rollercoaster on Eden Beach, where V and Johnny can buckle in for the ride of their life that doesn't involve guns and corpos.

It might be a minor side job, but it's still secretive and a lot of fun for players who want to spend quality time with Johnny outside his nihilistic ways and the murder that comes with it, permitting a chance to just have a fun ride without the drama.

17 I’ll Fly Away

Give Scorpion the Funeral He Would Have Wanted

  • Location: Mobile Camp, Rocky Ridge, the Badlands
  • How to Acquire: Complete Riders on the Storm and speak to Mitch Anderson
  • Rewards: Stinger, Action Figure, 2,303 XP, 3,454 Street Cred

I'll Fly Away is another minor side job, but it's one that is very easy to miss if players continue through Panam's quest chain without interacting with Mitch Anderson, as this quest will not be available if players help the Aldecaldos move camp across the Badlands, and for the sake of the Aldecaldos, this sweet quest is one to experience.

The quest itself involves V and Mitch giving his pal Scorpion the funeral he would have wanted, and players even receive a new weapon and some loot for helping. It's always nice to help a friend, especially when V themselves are grieving the loss of their own best friend with Jackie now gone.

16 Happy Together

Understand Barry’s Pain and Prevent His Suicide

  • Location: Megabuilding H10, Watson
  • How to Acquire: Complete Act One
  • Rewards: None

Happy Together will be one of the first side jobs that players will uncover in Night City as it will activate immediately in Act 2 after players have met Johnny Silverhand. The quest itself involves two worried cops as they try to check in on V’s neighbor, Barry Lewis, a former NCPD cop who hasn’t been seen in days and grieves alone at the loss of his friend.

If V decides to talk to Barry and just leave it there, then Barry will end up dead in a few days. However, V can travel to the Columbarium in North Oak and find the grave of Barry’s friend Andrew – a turtle. V can take this knowledge to the cops outside of Barry’s apartment and save his life by allowing people to show that they understand his grief.

15 Machine Gun

Find Regina Jones’ Rhianna-Loving Smart Pistol

  • Location: Alley in Vista del Rey, Heywood
  • How to Acquire: Complete Act One
  • Rewards: Skippy (Iconic Smart Pistol)

Venturing to Vista del Rey in Heywood, players will find a corpse with a rather special weapon: Skippy. Skippy is a beloved gun for a few reasons. Not only does it have a pretty good set of Iconic modifiers and uses a Smart Link to aim for the head, but it also speaks to V with a sassy and loyal charm. Yet, that charm runs out after 8 in-game days, when Skippy asks to be returned to his owner: Regina Jones.

Players can return Skippy to Regina, or decide to keep the gun for themselves. Regardless of their choice, it’s worth noting how fun and secret Skippy is, for he has two firing modes: Puppy-Loving Pacifist and Stone Cold Killer. If players choose the former, then after 100 kills he will permanently switch to the latter, and vice versa.

14 The Highwayman

Uncover the Sad Fate of Two Lovers for a Sweet Bike

  • Location: Behind the Gun-O-Rama in Rancho Coronado, Santo Domingo
  • How to Acquire: Pick up the photo of James and Josie in the garage
  • Rewards: ARCH Nazare “Itsumade”

Within Rancho Coronado East, players can find a garage with a decal of a skeletal horse just behind the Gun-O-Rama shop. Doing so will proceed with The Highwayman, a hidden quest in Cyberpunk 2077 that will have V and Johnny investigate the fate of the two lovers photographed within the garage, James and Josie. When finding James in Japantown, an investigation truly begins.

While The Highwayman might not have the greatest ending for two lovers, it’s still one worth completing to find out how cruel Night City can be, and to obtain a stolen Tyger Claw motorcycle: the ARCH Nazare “Itsumade” that will provide players with one of the best motorcycles in Cyberpunk 2077 .

13 Murk Man Returns Again Once More Forever

Obtain Night City’s Very Own Batmobile

  • Location: Rocky Ridge mine tunnel in the Badlands
  • How to Acquire: Complete Ghost Town
  • Rewards: Rayfield Caliburn “Murkmobile”

Once players have aided in Panam Palmer’s quests with Ghost Town, players can actually head back into the same tunnel where V and Panam fought and killed the Wraiths and Raffen Shiv. Within these tunnels, there’s a dark secret found within one of the abandoned shipping containers, and inside is a Rayfield Caliburn “Murkmobile”, indicating that a vigilante uses these tunnels to move around – perhaps much like a famed DC Comics hero with a thing for bats?

Sadly, there is no Murk Man to stop V here, and only a data shard will prove that a vigilante roams Night City and the Badlands. V can take the Murkmobile for their own garage, but as far as this quest goes, there isn’t much action other than the thrills of high speeds with a new ride from the Badlands.

12 Dressed to Kill

A Photoshoot Gone Wrong Provides V With a New Ride

  • Location: Desert Film Set in Rocky Ridge, Badlands
  • How to Acquire: Visit the Desert Film Set
  • Rewards: Thorton Colby CX410 “Gran Butte”

For the Vs out there who like to explore the Badlands, feel free to check out the desolate Desert Film Set location at Jeff’s Dirt Track, which has quite a few corpses scattered throughout. While V might spot a Trauma Team vehicle leaving the area, all the evidence around and the data shards suggest a photoshoot that didn’t exactly go as planned thanks to the Wraiths.

While this is a quest that tells a visual story rather than having V get into the combat themselves, it’s still interesting to see the life of Night City go on, and even more interesting to claim yet another free vehicle for V’s collection with the abandoned Thorton Colby CX410 “Gran Butte”.

11 1R-ONC-LAD

A Scavenger Hunt in the Petrochem Stadium to

  • Location: Green shipping container in the EBM Petrochem Stadium, Dogtown
  • How to Acquire: Access Dogtown with the Phantom Liberty DLC
  • Rewards: Eurodollars, Skill Shard (dependant)

Within the Petrochem, players can uncover the flickering and sparking body of a robot, waiting for help. Interacting with the robot reveals itself as 1R-ONC-LAD, and now V has to explore the Peotrchem Stadium in search of computers and scavenger drops to rebuild 1R-ONC-LAD’s database so that it may once again be repaired.

1R-ONC-LAD is like the Cyberpunk 2077 Pinocchio, but is providing a robot with a sense of morality a good idea? Players can either wipe 1R-ONC-LAD’s memory, leave the bot alone to complete its revenge, or reprogram it so that it becomes a talented guitarist – the third option provides V with Eurodollars and a Skill Shard a few days later if V returns to 1R-ONC-LAD’s now abandoned location.

item.title: Five Years Ago, Ghost of Tsushima Let Me Wander When the World Locked Down
item.description:
It's July 2020, and just like everyone else, I'm locked down in my home while I wait for COVID-19 to leave the world alone so we can get back to our normal lives again. Video games have always been a significant part of my life, but even more now, as my pregnant wife and I have found ourselves sitting around at home more than we ever did before. I'm grinding away at two of my favorite recently released games, Animal Crossing: New Horizons for its cozy vibes, and Final Fantasy 7 Remake because I love Final Fantasy and I always will. Then, a friend comes along and interrupts that grind with a comment about a game called Ghost of Tsushima , and I'm intrigued.

I actually hadn't even heard of it. My job as a video game journalist hadn't started at that point, despite already having my B.A. in Mass Communications and Media Studies, so I wasn't necessarily up to date on all the current events in the gaming industry to the extent that I am today. Nevertheless, I took my friend's advice and started reading reviews of Ghost of Tsushima , eventually walking away with questions about why I had never heard of it and why I was not currently playing it. I immediately purchased it and dove into its breathtaking open world, only to discover an adventurous escape I had been craving during such a tumultuous time as the COVID-19 pandemic.

Ghost of Tsushima Broke Me Out of COVID Prison

Ghost of Tsushima's Open World Was the Escape I Needed

Apart from what I had seen in reviews, I didn't know what to expect with Ghost of Tsushima , but it certainly wasn't what I ended up getting. I had grown to appreciate and even crave open-world games by that time, simply because of how much they offer in terms of content — even if that content is frequently artificial in nature. Prior to September 2020, I didn't have kids, meaning I had more time to invest in sizable maps filled with icons and achieve 100% completion on massive games like Assassin's Creed Odyssey without giving a second thought to how they could be designed differently. So, naturally, when I met Ghost of Tsushima , I fell in love with its world.

Sure, the gameplay aspect of its open-world design takes plenty of cues from a formula that has since been condemned, with repetitive activities and perhaps too many map markers, although that part is more subjective. And to be fair, I did begin noticing that at the time, to the point where I eventually expressed the desire for Ghost of Yotei to treat its open world differently. However, it wasn't the content in Ghost of Tsushima 's open world that I cared about so much as it was the way it gently guided me through its peaceful, immersive world and set me free, in a sense, especially during a year when I felt trapped, suffocated, and uncertain about the future.

Ghost of Tsushima Offered Me Peace During a Time of Chaos and Uncertainty

Much of that immersion came from its minimalistic HUD, which, in turn, highlighted the undeniable beauty of its world. Most open-world games offer players a compass or mini-map to guide them, but Ghost of Tsushima led me through feudal Japan with its innovative Guiding Wind mechanic, even when I had a custom waypoint set. It was something I had never experienced before, and not only was it a brilliant way to replace a potentially immersion-breaking UI, but it encouraged my investment in the path rather than the destination, and the sound of the wind sweeping across Tsushima Island gave me an overwhelming sense of calm as I explored.

It wasn't the content in Ghost of Tsushima 's open world that I cared about so much as it was the way it gently guided me through its peaceful, immersive world and set me free, in a sense, especially during a year when I felt trapped, suffocated, and uncertain about the future.

Ultimately, I treated Ghost of Tsushima as I would have any other open-world game at the time, ignoring the main quest as often as I could, choosing instead to let myself wander into the unknown. However, things were different this time, as exploration felt less about gameplay and more about discovery. Even without a clear objective at times, moving in any direction still felt like I was going somewhere that mattered, as real life asked me to stop going altogether and Ghost of Tsushima simply asked me to slow down and take in its gorgeous vistas.

Here, I found peace. Despite the real world around me seemingly coming to a halt in many ways, the questions that swirled overhead still made it feel like everything was careening toward the end of an era. But the tranquility of Ghost of Tsushima somehow silenced all of those questions for a bit. Ghost of Tsushima , in its own quiet, had a way of being louder than the confusion, anxiety, concern, and doubt that the world was echoing on social media and news outlets while we all remained indoors. It didn't offer answers, but it gave me a place to breathe. And for that brief window of time, that was exactly what I needed.

item.title: Fortnite Leak Reveals New Details About Upcoming Anime Collaboration
item.description:
Summary

  • The leaked collaboration with One Punch Man may include two emotes and a unique pickaxe.
  • The Fantastic Four may be coming to Fortnite as part of a collaboration with the upcoming MCU film.
  • Leaks have claimed that players may soon be able to team up in groups of six in Fortnite.

A popular Fortnite leaker has revealed new details about the battle royale's rumored upcoming collaboration with the hit anime One Punch Man , and it likely includes more than just a new skin. Fortnite is currently in the middle of Chapter 6 Season 3, which features a major collaboration with James Gunn's newest film, Superman .

It was recently leaked that Fortnite could be collaborating with the MCU once again, as some dataminers have found evidence that Epic Games will be adding skins for Mister Fantastic, Invisible Woman, Human Torch, and The Thing to the title soon. More leakers recently claimed that the iconic villain Galactus could also be on the way. While there's no confirmed release date for the potential crossover, some leakers have said they expect to see the cosmetics make their debut alongside the launch of The Fantastic Four: First Steps on July 25.

In a recent post on Twitter, the prominent leaker Loolo_WLRD shared new details about a potential upcoming collaboration between the popular anime One Punch Man and Fortnite , which has been rumored for quite some time. According to the leaker, the upcoming cosmetics will include an emote with a speech bubble that says "OK." There will also be another emote, though the leaker couldn't share any specifics about it. Loolo_WRLD revealed that the collaboration will also come with some kind of unique pickaxe. Much to the dismay of eager fans, the leaker claimed that the One Punch Man cosmetics are not currently encrypted within the files, which likely means they won't be released in the near future. However, it's always possible that they could be added to the game with the launch of its next update.

Fortnite Leak Reveals One Punch Man Crossover Details

Loolo_WRLD also recently leaked that big changes could be coming to Fortnite 's Blitz Royale in the future, as it seems that Epic Games is considering removing bots from the popular game mode. According to the leaker, this change could be made in coordination with the release of a new six-player version of Blitz Royale. This would increase the current number of people who can be on a single team during a match. As of writing, players can primarily team up in groups of two, three, and four.

Similarly, Loolo_WRLD claimed that Fortnite OG could be releasing a new mode that allows players to team up in groups of six. Fortnite OG recently made a major change to the way the storm functions in the popular game mode, as the wait time between circles has been reduced. This could serve to keep the action flowing and prevent unnecessary downtime during a match. With so much content to enjoy and even more just around the corner, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Fortnite .
